value:
Today, we'll find out empirically if
increased sun exposure causes an
increase in magical power.

Back in Renais, I spent every waking
moment researching magic. There
was no time for waterside frivolity.

Sunburn? Not a problem. I'm using an
herb mixture from De Floris Mysticis
to block the sun's rays.

People are prone to falling in love in
summertime, you say? How strange.
There must be some magical cause...

Who knew sunlight felt so pleasant
against the skin? Hmm... On a scale
of 1 to 48, I'd say my mood's at a 3.

This castle's magic defenses would
be more effective if arranged such
that... Oh, excuse me. I forgot myself.$k$pMy name is Lute. I'm an envoy of
$Nf.

Drawing power from the sun like a
garden, no less. I'm just that good.

This minor setback has simply stoked
the fire in my belly.

Abysmal. I must return to the drawing
board to rethink my approach.

You ascertained that I'd have use
for this? Good. You're catching on.

I'm Lute, genius mage extraordinaire,
currently investigating how swimsuits
impact one's magical abilities.

My investigation into the correlation
between skin exposure and magical
ability has been quite fascinating.$k$pI concede that sunbathing in this garb
is rather more comfortable than
toiling away in my stuffy laboratory...$k$pHowever, all in all, this swimsuit has
not resulted in any measurable
change to my spell-casting.$k$pIn other words, regardless of the
outfit I wear, my magical abilities are
second to none.$k$pYou agree both work equally well,
yes? I am—say it with me—just
that good.
それ。
くらいなさい
うっ…
予想外です…
Trifling.
Blinding sunlight!
You'd prefer to drown?
To the depths with you.
Brought low by the sun.
ふう…
Choosing a suitable swimsuit was no trouble for someone of my natural intelligence. It required minimal research.
Let me read you my dissertation. It's entitled "Good Reasons the Summoner Could Have for Constantly Interrupting Me." *ahem*
I have little practical experience swimming, but someone of my natural talent and superiority should be able to master the art in fewer than 10 minutes.
Exposure to sunlight is good for plants, whereas humans wither with overexposure... Fascinating.
My mood? On a scale of 1 to 48, I'd say I'm at a 12.
This outfit has heightened my enjoyment of the beach, but why? Surely one of these books holds the answer...
You're a prodigy of sorts yourself. Our time together has done wonders for advancing my research.
As you say.
Are you certain?
Of course I'll swim.
